newsitem.title: USA: Elcom says to evaluate strategic options.
newsitem.headline: Elcom says to evaluate strategic options.

text.p: Elcom International Inc said Wednesday that its board of directors had authorized the hiring of an investment banking firm to evaluate strategic options, which could include the possible sale or merger of the company, potential strategic partners, and financing options.
The company said that its rapid growth and the board's belief that its stock is undervalued prompted the step.

In a press release, Chairman and Chief Executive Robert Crowell said,"the board of directors believes that the company's ability to enhance its growth by acquisitions is limited by the current valuation of the company's common stock. An appropriate arrangement with a strategic partner could help unlock the intrinsic potential of the company..." Elcom's stock closed on Tuesday at 5, close to its year low of 4-1/2.
